net.hudup.core.alg

Interface Alg

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CTSManager, DatasetParser, ExternalQuery, Metric
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAlg, AbstractMetric, Accuracy, BasicDatasetParser, ClassificationAccuracy, CompositeRecommender, ContextPrefilter, CorrelationAccuracy, DbServerIndicator, DefaultMetric, FlatServerIndicator, Indicator, KBaseIndicator, MemoryBasedCF, MemoryBasedRecommender, ModelBasedCF, ModelBasedRecommender, Neighbor2dCF, NeighborCF, NeighborItemBasedCF, NeighborUserBasedCF, PredictiveAccuracy, Recommender, RecommendRmiServerIndicator, RecommendSocketServerIndicator, ScannerParser, ServiceRecommender, SnapshotParser, TimeMetric

    public interface Alg
extends java.io.Serializable
    Alg is the most abstract interface for all algorithms. Alg is one of the most important interfaces. It declares the most basic methods in an algorithm. The most important thing is that every Alg owns a configuration specified by DataConfig class. Alg has five typical inherited interfaces as follows:
    • Recommendation algorithm Recommender.
    • Context template schema manager CTSManager.
    • Data set parser DatasetParser.
    • External query ExternalQuery.
    • Metric Metric.
    Alg provides configuration methods such as getConfig() and createDefaultConfig() which allow programmers to pass customization settings to a given algorithm before it runs. Every algorithm has a unique name as returned value of getName() method of Alg. Every algorithm is registered in system register table and identified by its name. Plugin manager presented by PluginManager interface discovers automatically all algorithms via their names at the booting time. Alg is the most general interface; anything that is programmable and executable is Alg.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      DataConfig createDefaultConfig()
      Creating default configuration, it is called every time method resetConfig() is called
      DataConfig getConfig()
      Getting the configuration of algorithm.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Declaring the name of algorithm, the name is used to query algorithm in register table, please see class of register table for more details.
      Alg newInstance()
      Create the new instance of algorithm, concrete algorithm is determined run-time.
      void resetConfig()
      Re-setting default configuration.

    • Method Detail

      • getConfig

        DataConfig getConfig()
        Getting the configuration of algorithm.
        Returns:
        Algorithm configuration represented by DataConfig

      • resetConfig

        void resetConfig()
        Re-setting default configuration.

      • createDefaultConfig

        DataConfig createDefaultConfig()
        Creating default configuration, it is called every time method resetConfig() is called
        Returns:
        Default configuration represented by DataConfig

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Declaring the name of algorithm, the name is used to query algorithm in register table, please see class of register table for more details. Plug-in manager discovers automatically all algorithms via their names.
        Returns:
        name of algorithm

      • newInstance

        Alg newInstance()
        Create the new instance of algorithm, concrete algorithm is determined run-time.
        Returns:
        New Alg instance
